result.execSummary:
The defendant Deborah M. Koszarek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deborah M. Koszarek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 11:40 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Kyle Reimann.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed. Restitution paid & VRCW.
State recites agreement. 
PLEA: Ct.1- Retail Theft- Intentionally Take>>NO CONTEST
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: $350.00 fine plus CC.
Adj: 11:46 a.m.
Plea hearing on March 10, 2015 at 11:20 am.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 2:36 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears with Attorney Kyle Reimann. 
Parties have not reached an agreement and state requests a PTC. 
JT to stay on the calendar. Jury Instructions to be filed within 1 week of the JT. 30 jurors to be called. 
Parties to set PTC with JA following court. 
Adj: 2:37 p.m.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Jury Trial on February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on February 5, 2015 at 02:20 pm.
Pre-trial conference on January 13, 2015 at 08:40 am.

No contact with victim(s): Walmart. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
